item.title: home
item.content:encoded:
design matters.

Every challenge is an opportunity to create positive change.

My conceptual practice synthesizes psychology, art, technology and research to produce meaningful, bold designs.

I believe work inspires itself. I follow a content-first approach to UX. I love to challenge ideas, learn new concepts, and question what we accept as standard.

Influenced by psychological patterns, emotions and behaviors, I strive to express critical content in a palatable, powerful way that appeals to common human nature.

From ideation to execution, no detail is unnecessary.

My method is design.
The experience is about you.

anna januszewski

creative digital designer

projects

    • Texas Harm Reduction Alliance

    • Fan Controlled Sports

item.title: Mobile Design
item.content:encoded:
mobile design

market hop

pop-ups with purpose.

stakeholder story

Working directly with the stakeholder, we collaborated to conduct in-person interviews with local vendors, market organizers and venue hosts.

By gathering this research, we were able to better target the blockers for small sellers and target the reasons for success with larger markets and vendors.

Our broad understanding of the issues allow us to better design an effective app that truly serves its purpose.

research + interview

In early prototyping, we identified the most important features to initially create and launch.

Working in tandem with the stakeholder, we imagined the visual aspects of the brand and initial look and feel of Market Hop. With these goals in mind, I began the UI process to build the app through wireframing, styling, prototyping and debugging the app.

As we continue to expand and specify our next features, our project grows with ambition.

prototype design

Market Hop, a mobile-first market alternative app, is the passion project of a local business owner, photographer and foodie.

By creating a platform to create visibility for small vendors, our goal is to provide equal opportunity for independent farmers and creators who are commonly overrun or deterred from traditional markets.

Her focus on providing healthy, fresh food by collaborating with local venues and owners is a driving force behind the project.

Mood + Design Inspiration

Requirements Drafting + Mock-Ups

The early stages of the design process arent always pretty.

Working directly with the stakeholder, we brainstormed our final product goals. Below is a visual peek into the design process.

 

Market Hop: Wireframe Overview

Each step of the iteration and design test process is critical to developing an effective product.

From digital drawings to digital prototypes, hundreds of details are continuing to be altered and optimized for the Market Hop app.

Figma Prototype Preview

project gallery

item.title: Resume
item.content:encoded:
resume

Fan Controlled Sports Entertainment
UI Designer 2021 - 2023

QA analyst and web design editor for an expansive, tech-first football league focused on cryptocurrency, apps, and web-audience interaction.

Working with a team of developers, I iterated the UI design of our website to increase appeal, quality, and functionality for users, while stress testing the efficacy of the new design and verifying the quality of the written code post-execution

Kenilworth Construction
UX/UI Designer 2018 - 2019

UI/UX web designer, brand, marketing and outreach director for an independent, start-up roofing company.

Independently contracted,
necessary skills and tools included UI Design, Community Outreach, Content Strategy, Adobe Illustrator, Business Requirements and Analytical Skills.

Impressico Business Solutions
UX/UI Designer 2021 - 2023

Contracted through Impressico, I was brought on to help start and grow the North American QA team while also testing the UI/UX functionality of various projects.

Projects Include:
- Fan Controlled Football v2.0, v3.0
- EZ Pawn Corporation
- Market Hop
- Cognosis Medical Tech

EZ-Pawn Corporation
UX/UI Designer 2021 - 2023

User researcher and tester focused on 0-1 level app development to digitize the inventory system of 600 international pawn shops. I studied, personally executed, and documented modern store inventory methods, which did not include wireless internet solutions.

During development, I provided UX documentation and direct UI feedback to create and improve a digitized inventory application for the corporation.

Market Hop
UX/UI Designer 2020 - 2023

Lead designer and user researcher to the stakeholder. From ideation to prototypes, we created a local mapping platform to find pop-up markets and events, with the underlying goal to provide market-alternative solutions for small businesses.

Key tasks included branding, wireframing and prototyping the mobile app and webpage. Development is pending on this new project.

Texas Harm Reduction Alliance
UX/UI Designer 2023

UX/UI web designer and researcher, tasked with creating a new RWD interface and brand kit for the local non-profit organization Texas Harm Reduction Alliance.

This initiative includes supporting the research efforts of the THRA in providing sterile supplies to homeless, drug addicted citizens in Texas.

Clark & Addison Design
CEO + Creative Digital Designer

C&A Design is my independent company. My passion for design has allowed me to gain experience through various individual freelancing projects.

Atelier Minneapolis, School of Art
Professional Study

Formal, residential training in classical artistic methods and historical study. Primary mediums learned include charcoal, pencil, and greyscale painting.

National Geographic, Photography
Professional Study

Hands-on photography training with a National Geographic photographer. One-on-one field practice of dynamic landscape photography was studied. Located in Carmel-by-the-Sea, California.

education

University of Texas at Austin

Graduate Certificate

Graduate level UX/UI study in User Research, Ideation, Iteration, RWD, Branding, Interface design, and Front End Development. Primary tools include Figma, Miro,and Adobe Suite.

University of Wisconsin - Madison

Bachelor's Degree, Certificate

Degrees awarded in Psychology, Creative Writing, and certification in French language. This curriculum included graduate level coursework and practices in iteration. Honors distinction awarded.

University of London

Undergraduate Certificate

Immersive, study abroad program with a fast-paced curriculum focused on art history, practices and design concepts. Certificate in Art History awarded.

University of Saint Thomas
Undergraduate Study

Undergraduate study focused in Philosophy, Marketing and Psychology. This curriculum highly encouraged collaboration through workshops and group projects.

Sorbonne Universite
Undergraduate Study

Comprehensive undergraduate level program taught in Paris, France, by and with native speakers. Primary areas of study included French Language, English, and French History.

University of Minnesota - Twin Cities
Undergraduate Study

AP and Honors distinctions allowed me to participate in undergraduate courses in Literature and Creative Writing while in high school.

For further information regarding my educational and professional background, please visit my LinkedIn or Contact Me.

item.title: Office Paws
item.content:encoded:
office paws

Georgia B

My monster. A Parvo-surviving, polka dot pocket pittie, Georgia B always runs the show. Known around the block as Queen Geebs, she is a tornado of energy and affection.

Georgia B is a fetch-obsessed, challengingly smart, sassy and wiggly girl.

Saved from a ditch just weeks after being born, Austin Pets Alive! immediately treated Georgia B for Parvo, saving her life.

She is my two year old monster mash, and has her own Instagram, @georgiaqueenofspots.

Umbreon

Umbreon is a little bear. Adopted from a pet store litter, his sweet demeanor and casanova personality draws all attention to him.

He enjoys being held, snuggled, doted on and carried like a baby. He enjoys fruity snacks, toothbrush chompies, and new haircuts.

Now five years old, he has learned to enjoy the outdoors and playing with his big sister, Georgia B.

Snuggz

Snuggz (previously Pooh Bear) chose to sit in a parking spot at a military reserve unit, on 9/11.

Soldiers at the unit brought him to Austin, where we assessed his health and got treatment through AAC. He was fully stray with a long road ahead of him, but we assured his safety.

Labeled as aggressive by the shelter, he suffers from early onset cataracts and is actually blind - not aggressive.

He was then unexpectedly adopted by the soldier, my best friend, on Veterans Day 2021. Now a two year old hunk of love and cuddles, he travels the country for chicken nuggets with his dad. He also has an Instagram, @lotsofsnuggz.

Dixie

Dixie was our first family rescue. Adopted from the Saint Paul Humane Society after being transferred north from Dallas, She was a thin, 1.5 year old pup with pneumonia. We brought her home and slept with her on the couch, medicated her and massaged her chest the first few weeks.

She is now a four and enjoys her daily double trips to the dog park, her peanut butter Kong, and snoring in moms lap. Queen of side-eye.

you cant always
choose your coworkers,
but you can
always adopt one.

adoptables at AAC

item.title: Copy & Print
item.content:encoded:
copy + print

arts newsletter

project process

stakeholder story

The Arts & Thoughts newsletter was inspired by my father, who had lost touch with his artistic ways during his long career in finance.

To encourage other artists like him to begin incorporating art and philosophy back into their daily lives, I curated a crowd-sourced newsletter that prompts creative theories, thoughts and engagement with the arts.

Topics that are touched on within the newsletter include art, philosophy, writing, physiology, applicable psychology and photography practices.

design influence

The design content of the newsletter is carefully chosen. The target audience is intended for busy, career-oriented or older readers.

To gently encourage acknowledging art in every day life, the design of the article is influenced by interior design, still life, and current news events.

To add more creative accessibility, suggestions for instrumental and popular music tracks are included as suggestive listening during daily activities or while reading the newsletter.

These components together help stimulate the artistic brains of our readers.

presentation

The presentation of the newsletter comes from the crowd-source format. By posing open-ending questions and applicable exercises, I openly solicit direct feedback from readers. I incorporate these responses into iterative content that fuels the newsletter.

The content design of the newsletter is intended to cover artistic topics, but the design itself is also open to discussion.

From month to month, I collect readers feedback on content and design to directly iterate future editions.

01.08.2023

01.08.2023

01.08.2023

project gallery

item.title: Web Design
item.content:encoded:
web design

Breast Cancer Awareness

the men and women featured on this page are real breast cancer survivors.

a mastectomy
(removal of the breast tissue)
is a common treatment and preventative surgery for breast cancer patients.

our audience

The patient-facing toggle of the website faintly differs from the provider view; our goal is to differentiate the patient view by prioritizing primary resources, lessening medical terminology, and creating a more relaxing experience for all visitors.

Through our new design, we chose to emulate a softer feel to mirror our more empathetic tone.

In future iterations, we hope to create a full topic redesign specifically for increasing participation in breast cancer prevention and screenings.

project goals

Due to the immense body of information on the Cancer.Gov site, our team selected to follow the general established format and feel of the site.

The presentation of content, functionality and efficacy of our redesign was inspired by independent initiatives, tissue donation organizations and natural healing therapy centers.

By mimicking the moods and patterns across these related topics, we are better able to portray Cancer.Gov as a source of support and well-being.

design influence

In this collaborative study, our team worked to iterate upon the key pages of the Cancer.Gov webpage.

One prominent point of our redesign study is to reidentify the sites audience. We aimed to prioritize the most accessed information and forms on the site.

When carefully considering the emotional content of the site, we redesigned pages to cater to our true audience; the current site offers little support for undiagnosed, early-stage diagnosis and screening cases.

screening for cancer saves lives.

Increase Usability

The Cancer.Gov webpage displays an immense body of information being provided to visitors.

By eliminating extraneous user paths and incorporating iconography in place of text reduces the overwhelming presentation of information.

Redefining our audience, simplifying the information architecture, softening styles, and amplifying primary resources are the main objectives of this case study.

Increase Awareness

Prioritizing the most applicable information and resources for visitors will deliver critical information effectively and appropriately.

By eliminating extraneous user paths and incorporating iconography in place of text reduces the overwhelming presentation of information.

Getting regular screenings and performing self-exams can save not only your life, but the lives of your children and family.

Increase Prevention

Recommendations for cancer screening are sparse on the Cancer.gov webpage.

By leading with heavy medical terminology recruiting medical research participation, the stress of a recent diagnosis is exacerbated by a focus on late-stage cancers.

Cancer screening can identify early stage cancers and genetic markers that cause heightened risks of breast and other cancers.

Wireframes + Iterations

current site evaluation

team iterations

Figma Design File

project gallery

item.title: Branding
item.content:encoded:
branding

moua patissserie

project process

stakeholder story

The inspiration behind the entire bakery concept is to create a beautiful, Hmong-French space, with local appeal and a uniquely strong voice.

By drawing from natural patterns, histories, and stories of Hmong women, we worked to design an upscale French-Hmong bakery from menu print to interior design.

Within the physical space, the bakery presentation included embroidered details, woven and basket themes, and bold yet subtle punches of spicy color.

project context

The service industry is wearisome, with long hours of physical labor and often limited pay. For women, we also face the ongoing challenges of sexism, harassment and discrimination to even ascertain our jobs.

In an environment largely controlled by male chefs and managers, women are often limited to pastry rooms - baking, decorating, and garnishing someone else's recipes.

In high-end hospitality, your first table could easily be your last.

design influence

Moua Patisserie is the dream child of a four-time James Beard Award nominated pastry chef. To begin her own ventures, she sought to build a brand around her food that truly expressed her Hmong heritage.

Chef Moua has not only prevailed in her field, but has set an industry standard of women being bold, poignant, and fearless in their own pursuits. She is regarded as one of the best technical pastry chefs in the country, and an example of passionate determination far beyond Minneapolis.

design goal: fiercely feminine.

The Little Kumquat

My relationship with Chef Moua began with a school project I had filmed in her formal restaurant in 2011. Since, her career has continued to escalate and Chef Moua is now recognized as one of the best pastry chefs in the country.

As the primary stakeholder, I was privy to her deeper ambitions behind the bakery concept. Initially, Chef Moua dubbed her space The Little Kumquat, a kitchen nickname she was given early in her career; standing at five feet tall, the name was adept - but quickly transitioned to Moua Patisserie with advice.

Motivated by her desire to serve the Hmong community, her business goals included catering weddings and funerals - events which last several days in Hmong culture. To establish and suit her growing business, I created a flexible, practical design, primed for expansion.

moua patisserie, delivered.

  • French.

    Drawing from Chef Mouas professional French training, style, and presentation of her own pastry, it was a focus to incorporate the high fidelity training behind her work.

  • Hmong.

    A driving factor behind the bakerys conception was the expression of Hmong culture. A key influence behind the overall design of the brand is rooted in Hmong tradition.

  • Inspired.

    The ultimate display of brand is the logo. The Moua logo is drawn from the traditional Hmong embroidery pattern representing house and home. This welcoming design is modern, flexible, and simple.

  • Feminine.

    Gentle patterns, pastel coloring, and soft edges emulate femininity in this design. The brand palette is curated to reflect the bold colors of embroidery, warm tones of fresh baking, and the grace of Chef Mouas delicate presentation.

  • Classic.

    Chef Moua desired to iterate upon her previous experiences in high-end restaurants. By creating a minimalist menu design, we communicate the focus of the work : pastry.
    Iterations of the color palette include soft beiges, natural wood tones, and bold, textural accents.

  • Familiar.

    Chef Moua has a long, established career in and around Minneapolis. Her previous works are displays of pastry perfection. In her new endeavor, she wished to carry her local legacy through familiar design.

  • Natural.

    My strength in design is drawing upon natural patterns and colors. By incorporating both the color and symbolism of flowers throughout the design, we created a brand feel that was soft, yet powerful.

project gallery

item.title: Hospitality
item.content:encoded:
branding

moua patissserie

project process

stakeholder story

The inspiration behind the entire bakery concept is to create a beautiful, Hmong-French space, with local appeal and a uniquely strong voice.

By drawing from natural patterns, histories, and stories of Hmong women, we worked to design an upscale French-Hmong bakery from menu print to interior design.

    Iterations of the color palette include soft beiges, natural wood tones, and bold, textural accents.

  • Familiar.

    Chef Moua has a long, established career in and around Minneapolis. Her previous works are displays of pastry perfection. In her new endeavor, she wished to carry her local legacy through familiar design.

  • Natural.

    My strength in design is drawing upon natural patterns and colors. By incorporating both the color and symbolism of flowers throughout the design, we created a brand feel that was soft, yet powerful.

project gallery

item.title: Animal Rescue
item.content:encoded:
case study

austin animal center

project process

all pitties featured on this page are ready for a loving home.
boop a nose to choose your new best friend.

project purpose

Individual examples of the no-care issue in our community occur constantly. Vulnerable, injured, pregnant and post-partum dogs are rejected from city care and shelter due to a lack of resources and an inability to communicate the severity of the issue.

Neighbors who have concerns over local stray and missing pets are only encouraged to post flyers and foster the pet indefinitely.

Contacting 311, Animal Control, or Austin Animal Center directly are currently providing no life-saving alternatives to overcrowding of the shelters.

Veterinary clinics are unable to accept stray animals. Frequently, animals are referred to shelters out of county, then are turned away due to jurisdictional limitations.

Local rescues, based out of homes, are quickly filled by animals rejected by the city - though there are few fosters providing in-home rehabilitative care.

case studies

The goals for this initiative call for participation from both the city and local community.

Cases of animal mistreatment have been mitigated by individual efforts in the community. We are beginning an initiative to the Austin City Council to audit the treatment and care provided to dogs at Austin Animal Center.

The goals of this initiative are to gain awareness for the animal mistreatment and capacity patterns that occur during peak mating season and mild weather.

Animals that do not receive an immediate response from Animal Control and AAC stand a much higher risk of dying during the impending, hot summer months.

The level of care offered at Austin Animal Center has deteriorated with city growth - an inability to gain funding and gainfully employ individuals to care for animals has left them far behind pace with expansion.

taking initiative

This spring, Austin Animal Center has reached and overflown their limits of capacity and care for rescued and sheltered animals.

This overcrowding and selectivity of adoptables is leaving many pets and strays to be left without care, traumatized, or dead, both in the shelter and on the street.

Efforts from the City of Austin to brand themselves as a no-kill city has evolved into a mission of no care.

Puppies of age, dogs who are especially cute, purebred, or otherwise physically appealing are accepted by AAC and pushed for adoption first, while injured and sick dogs are being left on the street by city employees.

Without the lack of capacity to take in sick and abandoned animals combined with the legal restrictions on euthanasia, lost and stray animals are suffering every single day in Austin - right this minute.

the case studies below contain images related to animal abuse and abandonment.
these animals were saved and sheltered by few active volunteers in the community.
as of today, none of the cases have been resolved.

Austin, TX - 4.10.23

I just picked this poor baby up from a neighbor down the street. Couldnt let her die or be put down. Her back leg is extremely mangled, but she has a healthy appetite so she has a strong chance of survival. She also has a very sweet temperament. Ill be taking her to vet in the morning to be examined and have her checked for a microchip. Im almost sure she will have to have her back leg amputated. If she doesnt belong to anyone, Ill put her up for adoption.

Would anyone be willing to donate toward vet bill? If so, Ill set it up so donors will pay the vet directly. I really wont be able to afford the surgery cost, but Im just putting this out there now because Im going to be faced with a tough decision tomorrow. This sweet baby deserves a chance at life.

A GoFundMe was started by this finder to pay for the medical costs out of our own pockets.

Austin, TX - 3.29.23

I stopped for gas at Exxon on [street]. I saw a stray dog lying in one of the parking spaces. The clerk said he had been there since Sunday afternoon. He is skittish."

A professional trapper (a volunteer member of the community) was able to secure this dog. He is now in foster care after being rejected by the shelter.

Austin, TX - 4.09.23

If you know anything about this area you know its a dumping zone and Hades for dogs. He was reported as extremely skittish and constantly almost getting hit.

I basically left right away. When we got there we got eyes on quickly and while I was tracking looking for his area where he was bedded down in the brush I found a Mama tiny terrier and babies.

My soul felt crushed instantly. We trapped mama quickly and retrieved her babies from wet cold mud but daddy was on a whole other level. He continued to run onto the highway, I watched as several people tried to run him over, the police were called on us (worried neighbors) A Good Samaritan chased him on the highway refusing to listen to me. I felt death all around.

I also had neighbors threaten to shoot sweet boy because he wouldnt stop barking.
After close to 40 hours of being out there I hand captured!

This was no easy task! Please know its possible to get to a dogs emotional side of their brain with time and patience and you dont ever need to chase a dog! Mama, Dad, and two newborn tiny terriers are in desperate need of a foster.

Videos of the incident show the county Sheriff arriving and promptly leaving.

Mothers with litters are not accepted by local shelters. Claims have stated they do not have the care, capacity or time to care for post-partem mothers. They offer sponsorship on a rare, case-to-case basis for in-home fosters only.

to help these local rescuers, apply to foster or adopt below.

Jack Jacks Pack

*content verified and sourced by Austin L&F Pets Facebook group

emphasizing care over careless.

Rescue and Protect

The key drive behind this initiative is to rescue and protect dogs, cats, and other pets from homelessness and risk of death or disease.

Immediately increasing the network of volunteers prepared to secure loose pets with live traps, and donating to increase the ability of local rescues to care for dumped animals will reduce the number of pets spending another night left on the street.

Increase Foster Participation

There is an overwhelmingly small network of individuals volunteering to foster pets in their homes. While these pets sit in the shelter with minimal human interaction, they can become skittish, aggressive, or contract stress related diseases they would not otherwise experience.

Increasing a foster network defining the true commitments of pet fostering, alternatives, resources, term and specialty fosters will provide shelter for pets most in need.

Grants, Funding and Facility

To drastically reduce the number of stray, homeless, and injured pets, Austin Animal Center is in need of additional funding.

An increase in facility space, a larger employed staff, and access to better medical care would benefit all pets living in shelter.

Without additional resources, animals sent to shelter are suffering for weeks to years without stability, treats, playtime, or a loving home.

no pity for pitties. bully breed and pit-mix dogs face abundant discretion. changing the preconceptions of aggression among bully breed dogs is an important focus in this project. by rescuing, adopting, and spay or neutering your pittie, fewer bullies will be left without couches and Kongs.

project gallery

item.title: Case Study
item.content:encoded:
case study

austin animal center

project process

all pitties featured on this page are ready for a loving home.
boop a nose to choose your new best friend.

I just picked this poor baby up from a neighbor down the street. Couldnt let her die or be put down. Her back leg is extremely mangled, but she has a healthy appetite so she has a strong chance of survival. She also has a very sweet temperament. Ill be taking her to vet in the morning to be examined and have her checked for a microchip. Im almost sure she will have to have her back leg amputated. If she doesnt belong to anyone, Ill put her up for adoption.

Would anyone be willing to donate toward vet bill? If so, Ill set it up so donors will pay the vet directly. I really wont be able to afford the surgery cost, but Im just putting this out there now because Im going to be faced with a tough decision tomorrow. This sweet baby deserves a chance at life.

A GoFundMe was started by this finder to pay for the medical costs out of our own pockets.

Austin, TX - 3.29.23

I stopped for gas at Exxon on [street]. I saw a stray dog lying in one of the parking spaces. The clerk said he had been there since Sunday afternoon. He is skittish."

A professional trapper (a volunteer member of the community) was able to secure this dog. He is now in foster care after being rejected by the shelter.

Austin, TX - 4.09.23

If you know anything about this area you know its a dumping zone and Hades for dogs. He was reported as extremely skittish and constantly almost getting hit.

I basically left right away. When we got there we got eyes on quickly and while I was tracking looking for his area where he was bedded down in the brush I found a Mama tiny terrier and babies.

My soul felt crushed instantly. We trapped mama quickly and retrieved her babies from wet cold mud but daddy was on a whole other level. He continued to run onto the highway, I watched as several people tried to run him over, the police were called on us (worried neighbors) A Good Samaritan chased him on the highway refusing to listen to me. I felt death all around.

I also had neighbors threaten to shoot sweet boy because he wouldnt stop barking.
After close to 40 hours of being out there I hand captured!

This was no easy task! Please know its possible to get to a dogs emotional side of their brain with time and patience and you dont ever need to chase a dog! Mama, Dad, and two newborn tiny terriers are in desperate need of a foster.

Videos of the incident show the county Sheriff arriving and promptly leaving.

Mothers with litters are not accepted by local shelters. Claims have stated they do not have the care, capacity or time to care for post-partem mothers. They offer sponsorship on a rare, case-to-case basis for in-home fosters only.

to help these local rescuers, apply to foster or adopt below.

Jack Jacks Pack

*content verified and sourced by Austin L&F Pets Facebook group

emphasizing care over careless.

Rescue and Protect

The key drive behind this initiative is to rescue and protect dogs, cats, and other pets from homelessness and risk of death or disease.

Immediately increasing the network of volunteers prepared to secure loose pets with live traps, and donating to increase the ability of local rescues to care for dumped animals will reduce the number of pets spending another night left on the street.

Increase Foster Participation

There is an overwhelmingly small network of individuals volunteering to foster pets in their homes. While these pets sit in the shelter with minimal human interaction, they can become skittish, aggressive, or contract stress related diseases they would not otherwise experience.

Increasing a foster network defining the true commitments of pet fostering, alternatives, resources, term and specialty fosters will provide shelter for pets most in need.

Grants, Funding and Facility

To drastically reduce the number of stray, homeless, and injured pets, Austin Animal Center is in need of additional funding.

An increase in facility space, a larger employed staff, and access to better medical care would benefit all pets living in shelter.

Without additional resources, animals sent to shelter are suffering for weeks to years without stability, treats, playtime, or a loving home.

no pity for pitties. bully breed and pit-mix dogs face abundant discretion. changing the preconceptions of aggression among bully breed dogs is an important focus in this project. by rescuing, adopting, and spay or neutering your pittie, fewer bullies will be left without couches and Kongs.

project gallery

item.title: UX Research
item.content:encoded:
ux research

Texas Harm Reduction Alliance

project process

project purpose

To begin understanding the formation and purpose of the THRA, we started analyzing their past initiatives and current organizational structures.

This research revealed aggressive initiatives made by the THRA which struggled to receive approval from the City Council. Initiatives that had been approved, and were shown to be successful in providing direct aid to the community, proved unsustainable due to a lack of funding and resources.

Our purpose is to uncover, analyze, and integrate social, financial and political aspects within our full research plan.

deep research

The key focus of our iterated design was to target the audiences preconceptions about drug abuse and homelessness. Through UI design, we are able to manipulate the focus of our audience.

To replace outright requests for donations and misleading copy, we strived to bring the users focus directly to information regarding the topics of homelessness and drug use.

By focusing the user on critical, contextual information first, our goal is to clearly express the purpose of the organization.

presentation

In this collaborative project, we worked to identify key initiatives and blockers of the Texas Harm Reduction Alliance.

I personally selected this organization to target and challenge the preconceptions about our local unhoused and addicted community. Changing public opinion is difficult; we chose to emphasize awareness of the importance of the cause through palatable, accurate and effective UI design iteration.

Our redesign tackled highly psychological, socially biased issues, finding the cause paramount to the supporting the immediate needs of vulnerable communities.

identifying preconceptions.

Our process of this redesign weighed heavily on deep research into local politics, legal requirements and non-profit services. To produce the most effective solutions possible, we delivered palatable, succinct information to appeal to our target audiences.

Figma Prototypes
Full Presentation
Collaboration Board
Current THRA Site

project gallery

item.title: Small Business
item.content:encoded:
mobile design

market hop

pop-ups with purpose.

stakeholder story

Working directly with the stakeholder, we collaborated to conduct in-person interviews with local vendors, market organizers and venue hosts.

By gathering this research, we were able to better target the blockers for small sellers and target the reasons for success with larger markets and vendors.

Our broad understanding of the issues allow us to better design an effective app that truly serves its purpose.

research + interview

In early prototyping, we identified the most important features to initially create and launch.

Working in tandem with the stakeholder, we imagined the visual aspects of the brand and initial look and feel of Market Hop. With these goals in mind, I began the UI process to build the app through wireframing, styling, prototyping and debugging the app.

As we continue to expand and specify our next features, our project grows with ambition.

prototype design

Market Hop, a mobile-first market alternative app, is the passion project of a local business owner, photographer and foodie.

By creating a platform to create visibility for small vendors, our goal is to provide equal opportunity for independent farmers and creators who are commonly overrun or deterred from traditional markets.

Her focus on providing healthy, fresh food by collaborating with local venues and owners is a driving force behind the project.

Mood + Design Inspiration

Requirements Drafting + Mock-Ups

The early stages of the design process arent always pretty.

Working directly with the stakeholder, we brainstormed our final product goals. Below is a visual peek into the design process.

 

Market Hop: Wireframe Overview

Each step of the iteration and design test process is critical to developing an effective product.

From digital drawings to digital prototypes, hundreds of details are continuing to be altered and optimized for the Market Hop app.

Figma Prototype Preview

project gallery

item.title: Cancer Prevention
item.content:encoded:
web design

Breast Cancer Awareness

the men and women featured on this page are real breast cancer survivors.

a mastectomy
(removal of the breast tissue)
is a common treatment and preventative surgery for breast cancer patients.

our audience

The patient-facing toggle of the website faintly differs from the provider view; our goal is to differentiate the patient view by prioritizing primary resources, lessening medical terminology, and creating a more relaxing experience for all visitors.

Through our new design, we chose to emulate a softer feel to mirror our more empathetic tone.

In future iterations, we hope to create a full topic redesign specifically for increasing participation in breast cancer prevention and screenings.

project goals

Due to the immense body of information on the Cancer.Gov site, our team selected to follow the general established format and feel of the site.

The presentation of content, functionality and efficacy of our redesign was inspired by independent initiatives, tissue donation organizations and natural healing therapy centers.

By mimicking the moods and patterns across these related topics, we are better able to portray Cancer.Gov as a source of support and well-being.

design influence

In this collaborative study, our team worked to iterate upon the key pages of the Cancer.Gov webpage.

One prominent point of our redesign study is to reidentify the sites audience. We aimed to prioritize the most accessed information and forms on the site.

When carefully considering the emotional content of the site, we redesigned pages to cater to our true audience; the current site offers little support for undiagnosed, early-stage diagnosis and screening cases.

screening for cancer saves lives.

Increase Usability

The Cancer.Gov webpage displays an immense body of information being provided to visitors.

By eliminating extraneous user paths and incorporating iconography in place of text reduces the overwhelming presentation of information.

Redefining our audience, simplifying the information architecture, softening styles, and amplifying primary resources are the main objectives of this case study.

Increase Awareness

Prioritizing the most applicable information and resources for visitors will deliver critical information effectively and appropriately.

By eliminating extraneous user paths and incorporating iconography in place of text reduces the overwhelming presentation of information.

Getting regular screenings and performing self-exams can save not only your life, but the lives of your children and family.

Increase Prevention

Recommendations for cancer screening are sparse on the Cancer.gov webpage.

By leading with heavy medical terminology recruiting medical research participation, the stress of a recent diagnosis is exacerbated by a focus on late-stage cancers.

Cancer screening can identify early stage cancers and genetic markers that cause heightened risks of breast and other cancers.

Wireframes + Iterations

current site evaluation

team iterations

Figma Design File
